passages.1:1: The oracle concerning Nineveh-- the scroll of the vision of Nahum the Elkoshite:
passages.1:2: Yahweh is a jealous God and avenging; Yahweh is avenging and {full of wrath}.<note: Literally "a lord of wrath"> Yahweh takes vengeance against his enemies; he rages against his adversaries.
passages.1:3: Yahweh is slow to anger but great [in] power; he will certainly not allow [the guilty] to go unpunished. {He marches}<note: Literally "His path"> in storm wind and in gale; storm clouds [are the] dust of his feet.
passages.1:4: He rebukes the sea and he dries up the rivers; he makes all the rivers run dry. Bashan and Carmel wither;<note: MT reads "languishes," but the versions reflect "withers," which also restores the acrostic> the blossom of Lebanon languishes.
passages.1:5: Mountains quake before him; the hills shake apart.<note: Or "melt"> The earth heaves before him-- the world and all her inhabitants.
passages.1:6: His indignation--who can stand before it? Who can endure {his fierce anger}?<note: Literally "the heat of his anger"> His wrath is poured out like fire; rocks are shattered before<note: Or "by"> him.
passages.1:7: Yahweh is good--a refuge in [the] day of distress; [he knows] those who take refuge in him.
passages.1:8: But with a rushing torrent he will bring [Nineveh] to an end; he will chase his enemies into darkness.
passages.1:9: What<note: Or "Why ...?"> do you plot against Yahweh? {He will completely destroy it};<note: Literally "he will make a complete destruction"> trouble will not rise up a second time!
passages.1:10: For like entangled thorns, and like their drink which is drunk, they will be consumed like fully dry chaff.
passages.1:11: From you goes out one who plots evil against Yahweh, one who plans wickedness.
passages.1:12: Yahweh says this: "Even though [they are] powerful and likewise many, even so they will be cut off and pass away. Though I have afflicted you,<note: That is, Judah> I will afflict you<note: That is, Judah> no longer.
passages.1:13: And now, I will break his yoke from upon you; I will snap your bonds."
passages.1:14: Yahweh has commanded concerning you: "Your name will no longer be sown. I will cut off {the idols and images}<note: Literally "the idols and the molten idols"> from the {temple}<note: Literally "house"> of your gods; {I will send you to the grave}<note: Literally "I will make your grave"> because you are worthless."
passages.1:15: <note: Nahum 1:15-2:13 in the English Bible is 2:1-14 in the Hebrew Bible> Look! On the mountains! The feet of the one who brings good tidings, the one who proclaims peace! "Celebrate [a festival], O Judah, Fulfill your vows! For he will not invade you again; the wicked one is cut off completely!"
passages.2:1: {One who shatters}<note: Literally "a shatterer"> has come up against you! Guard [the] fortification! Watch [the] road!<note: Or "way"> Gird [your] loins! {Muster}<note: Or "Collect"> all [your] strength!
passages.2:2: For Yahweh will restore the majesty of Jacob like the majesty of Israel; for ravagers have ravaged them and ruined [their] branches.
passages.2:3: The shields of his warriors [are] dyed red; The powerful men [are] dressed in scarlet. The metal of the chariots<note: Hebrew "chariot"> [shines] like fire {on the day of battle},<note: Literally "on the day of his preparation"> and [their] spears quiver.
passages.2:4: The chariots<note: Hebrew "chariot"> race madly through the streets; they rush back and forth in the public squares. Their appearance like lightning bolts, they dart about like flashes of lightning.
passages.2:5: He calls his officers; they stumble as they march; they rush to her wall; they set the covering<note: The Hebrew word describes a small portable roof to protect siege warriors from arrows and debris hurled at them from the fortified city wall> in place.
passages.2:6: The gates of the river are opened; the palace trembles.
passages.2:7: {Her goddess is taken out and taken into exile};<note: Literally "It is decreed [that] she be exiled [and] led away." MT reads the very enigmatic "And he is placed, she is sent into exile, she is taken up." The BHS editors suggest the conjectural emendation "And her goddess [= the idol of the patron deity of Nineveh] is taken and taken into exile." This is adopted in the translation on the basis of internal evidence> her maidservants moan like doves; they beat on their breasts.
passages.2:8: Nineveh [is] like a pool of water without its water.<note: MT reads "from her days." Greek LXX and Syriac Peshitta reflect "from her waters"> {As they flee},<note: Literally "And they flee away"> [she cries,] "Stop! Stop!" But there is no one who turns back.
passages.2:9: Plunder the silver! Plunder the gold! There is no end to the spoils,<note: Literally "the supply"> an abundance of {everything one could want}!<note: Literally "every kind of desirable object">
passages.2:10: Emptiness and plundering and devastation! Their hearts faint and their knees tremble,<note: Or "totter"> {All their loins shake}<note: Literally "And shaking of all loins"> and all their faces {turn}<note: Literally "gather"> pale.
passages.2:11: Where [now] [is] the den of [the] lions and [the] cave of the fierce lions? There the lioness, the cub, and the lion once {prowled},<note: Literally "went"> {and no one disturbed them}.<note: Literally "there [is] no one making [them] afraid">
passages.2:12: The lion tore apart enough [prey] for his cubs, he strangled [prey] for his lioness; he filled {his lair}<note: Literally "his holes"> [with] prey and his den [with] mangled carcass.
passages.2:13: "Look! I am against you!" {declares}<note: Literally "a declaration of"> Yahweh of hosts. "I will burn her chariots {with fire};<note: Literally "with smoke"> the sword will devour fierce lions. I will cut off your prey from the earth; the voice of your messengers will no longer be heard."
passages.3:1: Woe to the city [that has shed] {much blood}!<note: Literally "bloods"> {She is a deceiver},<note: Literally "All of her [is] deception"> She is filled [with] plunder, {She has hoarded her spoils of war}.<note: Literally "Prey does not depart">
passages.3:2: The crack of the whip! The rumbling of the [chariot] wheel! The galloping of the horse! The racing of the chariot!
passages.3:3: Chariots charge! Swords flash! Spears glitter! {Many corpses are piled high}!<note: Literally "Many dead, piles of corpses"> There is no end to the slain! They stumble over their dead!
passages.3:4: "Because of the many idolatries of [the] prostitute, the beautiful charm [of] a mistress of witchcraft, she who enslaves nations by her harlotries, and peoples by her sorceries,
passages.3:5: "Look! I am against you!" {declares}<note: Literally "a declaration of">Yahweh. "I will strip up your skirts over your face; I will let nations look [at] your nakedness and your shame.
passages.3:6: "I will throw filth upon you, I will treat you with contempt, I will make you a spectacle.
passages.3:7: "And it will be that everyone who sees you will flee from you, And {they}<note: Hebrew "he"> will say, 'Nineveh is destroyed!' Who will mourn for her? From whence shall I seek comforters for you?"
passages.3:8: Are you better than Thebes?<note: Hebrew "No-Amon"> She who sits at the Nile, surrounded by her waters, her rampart [was the] sea and water [was] her wall.
passages.3:9: Cush [was] her strength, Egypt without end; Put and Libya were among {your allies}.<note: Literally "your helpers">
passages.3:10: Yet she went into captivity as an exile; her children were dashed to pieces at the head of [the] streets; they cast lots for all of her nobles; all of her dignitaries were bound with chains.
passages.3:11: You also will behave like a drunkard; You also will hide yourself; You also will seek refuge from [the] enemy.
passages.3:12: All of your fortifications [are like] fig trees with [ripe] firstfruits-- if they are shaken, they will fall into the mouth of the eater.
passages.3:13: Look! Your troops [are like] women in your midst. The gates of your land are wide open to your enemies; fire will consume the bars [of your gates].
passages.3:14: Draw water for a siege! Strengthen your fortifications! Go to the mud [pit]! Trample the clay! Grasp the brick mold!
passages.3:15: There fire will consume you; the sword will cut you off. It will consume you like the locust.
passages.3:16: You have increased your merchants more than the stars of heaven; [like] the locust they will shed [their skin] and fly away.
passages.3:17: Your officials [are] like locusts; your commanders [are] like a swarm of locusts. They encamp on the walls on a cold day; when the sun rises, they fly away-- no one knows where they have gone.
passages.3:18: Your shepherds are sleeping, [O] king of Assyria! Your nobles slumber. Your people are scattered on the mountains; no one can gather them.
passages.3:19: There is no healing for your wound; your injury is fatal. All who hear the report of you will clap [their] hands [for joy] concerning you, {For who has not suffered at the hands of your endless cruelty}?<note: Literally "For over whom has your endless cruelty not passed?">
